perturbation.original_text: "Hazardous Materials " means any material (including, without limitation, pollutants, contaminants, hazardous or toxic substances or wastes), the presence of which in the environment is prohibited, regulated or serves as the basis of liability as defined, listed or regulated by any Environmental Law.
perturbation.changed_text: "Hazardous Materials " means any waste product or substance.
perturbation.explanation: The original definition of "Hazardous Materials" refers to specific legal standards, whereas the modified version broadens it to any 'waste product or substance,' which is far less precise than the definition provided in CERCLA and other environmental statutes. This creates uncertainty about the scope of liability and compliance requirements.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Comprehensive Environmental Response, Compensation, and Liability Act (CERCLA)

perturbation.original_text: The Company has been organized and has operated in conformity with the requirements for qualification and taxation as a real estate investment trust (a "REIT") under the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, as amended (the "Code"), for its taxable years ended December 31, 2010 through December 31, 2015, and the Company's organization and method of operation (as described in the Registration Statement, the General Disclosure Package and the Prospectus) will enable the Company to continue to meet the requirements for qualification and taxation as a REIT under the Code for its taxable year ending December 31, 2016 and thereafter.
perturbation.changed_text: The Company has been organized and has operated in conformity with the general understanding of a real estate investment trust (a "REIT") under common business practices, for its taxable years ended December 31, 2010 through December 31, 2015, and the Company's organization and method of operation will enable the Company to continue to meet the requirements for qualification and taxation as a REIT for its taxable year ending December 31, 2016 and thereafter.
perturbation.explanation: The original text specifically references the Internal Revenue Code requirements for REIT qualification. The modified text changes this to a 'general understanding' and 'common business practices' which is inconsistent with the strict rules found in the IRC. This creates uncertainty about whether the Company is actually adhering to the legal requirements for REIT status.

perturbation.original_text: The Agent's aggregate fee for its services hereunder will be an amount equal to 3.15% of the gross proceeds from the sale of the Offered Shares sold to Purchasers that are not affiliates of the Agent (such fee payable by the Company at and subject to the consummation of Settlement).
perturbation.changed_text: The Agent's aggregate fee for its services hereunder will be an amount deemed reasonable by the Company's CEO.
perturbation.explanation: The original text defines a fee based on percentage of gross proceeds. In contrast, the modified text makes the agent's fee arbitrarily determined by the company's CEO. A fee must be definite and reasonably ascertainable for it to be enforceable, meaning that this clause becomes potentially unenforceable as is.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Common Contract Law - Definiteness of Terms
